intro: Soroseris hookeriana subsp. handelii, commonly known as the Hooker's soroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cooler, temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
